Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Papa127
Reviews.Content: Off the beaten path by only a block. This old quaint hotel is a perfect place to experience Paris. The street outside the hotel is packed with restaurants serving all types of food at reasonable prices. You are only a short walk from Notre Dame and if you really want a McDonalds, there is one a block away. I enjoyed sitting in the lobby and just watching the people go by on the street. At night the street is alive with people eating and the smells of the food works its way into the room. The elevator is small and if you have a big bag, it will only fit one person.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Athena222
Reviews.Content: I'm not a newcomer to Paris, but am a new convert to Hotel de Levant. I stayed here in January two different times in the same week -- two days after arriving, then the last day (after taking a trip to the South). The first room (24) was fine, but the second (chambre 41) was outstanding. Beautifully decorated -- compact for sure, but that's what hotel rooms in Paris are -- warm, and comfortable. Bathroom was not huge but sparkling clean. Layouts appear to be different in various rooms due to the fact that it's an old hotel. The first room had separate rooms for sink and bath and for the toilet. No big deal. Staff was friendly, breakfast very good and included in the room price, and location can't be beat. Highly recommended by a seasoned international traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, walk everywhere, near Shakespeare & Company, Notre Dame, Cuny”
Reviews.Author: sevillanitacubanita
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my 10 year old after having stayed the night before in a nearby hotel that cost only a litle less but was not as nice at all. Hotel du Levant was charming , our room was quiet so we slept well, and it included a much welcomed breakfast; nothing fancy but generous including a baket of croissants and French bread, butter, marmelade, cereals, hard boiled or soft boiled eggs I could make myself, other types of breads, juices and delicions coffee and fruits. A great way to start your day. The locatin was wonderful. My son really liked it too and wifi was free. I would definitely stay there again and hope that the price remains as is with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch location in the Latin Quarter, with some affordable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Marjorie77
Reviews.Content: I often attend business meetings at the universities of the Latin Quarter, and finding a hotel unexpensive enough for a poor civil servant is always tricky in this highly touristy neighbourhood. The Hotel du Levant is one of my solutions: some of its single rooms are rather unexpensive for the district, and it's quiet and clean. To top it all off, breakfast is included, and there's free Wifi in the rooms. If you're a tourist, or if you need to go to the Sorbonne, the location is ideal, next to metro Cluny-La Sorbonne (check it on a map)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location, and service”
Reviews.Author: AthensFrancophile
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay in a single room at this hotel. The bathroom was remodeled from my last stay and the shwoer was very spacious with a rain-type showerhead that delivered full pressure once I figured out how to adjust it proeprly. Well decirated room wiht refrigerator. Excelletn location between two metro lines, a three minute wlak to Notre Dame, etc. Good breakfast and breakfast service.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: RSD2001
Reviews.Content: Apples to apples (i.e. NOT the Ritz), as good as it gets. If you take the train in from the airport, you will appreciate that you have only a short walk from the St. Michel RER station; no transfers to a Metro line, no long treks with heavy luggage. Even so, the hotel is on a narrow side street that dates back to the Gallo-Roman period, away from the heavy traffic on St. Michel Blvd. There is a lot of boisterous student age pedestrian noise out and about late at night ... after all, this is the Latin Quarter ... but though we booked the fourth floor family suite which faced the rue de la Harpe, we slept comfortably. As others have commented, the included breakfast was excellent, the staff was very helpful. They confirmed our many requests for restaurant reservations, including one out in Versailles, with alacrity and without complaint. A charming hotel that evokes the Paris of Hemingway's A MOVABLE FEAST.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the "Charme Parisienne"”
Reviews.Author: Lepricano
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not very expensive, clean, friendly (I am a single woman traveller) and most of all located not far from Metro station in the real centre of the Latin Quarter. Very close to the Cluny Museum and on the other side of the river from Notre Dame and Marais. The rooms are small, but the price is comparable. I usually get a Standard single but if You have to stay more than 1 night I suggest an executive one! ,

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: unfrequentflyer
Reviews.Content: Like the previous reviewer, I am a faithful client of Hotel du Levant and this is in fact the tenth time I returned to the hotel for a 3 night stay. Unlike the previous reviewer however, I was not disappointed in any way. I stayed in a single room, which although small was perfectly functional. It was very clean and the single bed was very comfortable, in anything I suspect the mattress had been charged as it was very firm and I had a perfect sleep all three nights. If anything the TV has improved in that we now get a flat screen TV with a wide variety of channels. Wifi was free and that was a huge plus. The bathroom was larger than the one I stayed in at the Hotel Europe St Severin for which I paid a lot more too! The power of the shower could be improved in my opinion, but this could be due to the high floor. The air conditioner worked perfectly. Breakfast was a "semi-buffet" in that you get one croissant and one half baguette, but you could help yourself to as much corn flakes, muesli, cheese, ham, salami, fruit salad, yoghurt, orange juice, fresh fruit as you want. The coffee tasted as strong as it did before, you only have to specify if you want cafe, or cafe au lait, or a chocolat chaud. Enough has already been said about the excellent location of the hotel. Apart from the excellent public transport accessibility, it is right in the latin quarter with loads of restaurants so you never get hungry, and in fact the creperie next door is open for business 24/7. St Severin church is also just round the corner, and if you want cheap grocery supplies just walk towards the Cluny museum and opposite there is a Monoprix. Of course this hotel is not the Crillon or Mandarin Oriental, but for the asking price this has to be one of the best bargains in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buddhakkan
Reviews.Content: Located in a quaint safe road exactly 2 minutes walk from the St. Michel metro and surrounded by nice eateries. The hotel was conveniently located, walking distance from the Notre Dam and Louvre, other tourist locations was a train ride away. Taxis in Paris are a lot cheaper than many cities in Europe. We had a triple room which was large enough and well appointed. The breakfast was adequate and the staffs at the pantry were quite friendly. They also humoured my over inquisitive 7 year old and gave in to his demands. One area this hotel fell short was the reception staff, being primarily a tourist hotel it was disappointing that they did not know basics like the opening hours of Louvre or that Versailles is closed on Monday. While booking this hotel one must be conscious of the fact that the Latin Quarter is not the most upmarket location and neither the hotel is a fancy five or four star. It is at best a brilliant B&B which is most conveniently located where one can expect mostly good service and decent sized rooms in the middle of the city at a price that wont burn a hole in your pocket. I will come back and have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Cosy Hotel in the best area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: LeaLea0471
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous. I was in their single room which is quite small, but I didn't need anything bigger. The hotel was very clean, and the staff went out of their way to make you feel welcome. The location is fantastic as you can walk to many of the Parisian sites from here. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: Rois
Reviews.Content: This is ultimately a tourist hotel for those who like to be in the midst of the cheesy restaurants and close to Notre Dame. Our room was as small as expected - toilet and basin/shower separate on the other side of the room. Quiet apart from banging door from the next room. I don't have much to say on the over-rated staff - we weren't offered any amazing advice, but neither did we ask for it. We didn't even get an "au revior" when we paid the bill. Location was fantastic for Notre Dame and for access from CDG airport. Surrounding restaurants not great but at least the area was lively and gave the impression of holidays. We moved hotels to a different (branded) hotel for our last night of the 3-night visit, which was located at the Trocadero and is much more chic and pleasant than the latin quarter, but it's all about personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced Hotel in Quartier Latin”
Reviews.Author: Edward B
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at this moderately priced (for Paris) hotel, which is located in a district of restaurants and within walking distance of the metro and major sightseeing attractions. The queen-sized bed was comfortable and the tv, minibar and bathroom (with a tub) were good. Our room overlooked the courtyard and picked up none of the noise from the bustling rue de la Harpe restaurant district. Breakfast was hearty, including hatrd-boiled eggs, ham, cheese, some fruit and other items going beyond the routine continental breakfast. The lift could just barely accommodate two persons with luggage, but patrons waited good-naturedly. There was WiFi in the room, but no business center. I walked to the Sorbonne to use a cyrbercafe. This is a great place for persons who wish to explore the food and sights of Paris without blowing their budget on a room.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Gem”
Reviews.Author: etonMilford
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel! Staff very welcoming and accommodating. Great breakfast and WiFi included also a nice incentive in the hotel market in Paris. Street a bit noisy when windows were open only. Good location for Metro. Very convenient for new visitors to Paris. Notre Dame very close!

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL, EXCELENT SITUATION”
Reviews.Author: esteban95
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel located right in the middle of the famous Latin Quarter .When you walk out of the hotel you can find numerous restaurants and cafes . This street is very animated and has lively crowds . Very close to the Metro stop and 100 mt. from the Sena River, Notre Dam Cathedral , La Sorbonne , and Jardin of Luxembourg. The double rooms are a bit small but as we were three at this opportunity we had a triple room very comfortable with a very nice bathroom ( individual airco, minibar and free safe). This room was in the third floor, facing the street but we heard no noise at night and slept excellent. The elevator always works perfectly although its a bit small ! The breakfast is typical french ( one bread, one croissant, and ham, cheese, eggs , ) but sufficient. This hotel still retains loads of character and we really love the Rue de la Harpe street . It was our fifth stay and we will surely return next year .

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: marybee333
Reviews.Content: Staff was courteous and friendly and the neighborhood is happening! Delicious crepes right outside the front door. Very close to bus line, subway and open tour bus/boats. Walk to Notre Dame was fun for outdoor street performances in the evenings as well as impromptu street parties along the Seine. We had a quiet, clean well decorated room with a nice shower. The rooms are small, but have efficient storage space like you would find in a basic cruise ship room. Breakfast was adequate and there is a nice sitting room on the first floor. Had a great stay and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best.”
Reviews.Author: Kazoo22
Reviews.Content: This hotel really did an outstanding job in all respects: Friendly and helpful staff, quiet, clean, and well decorated. Breakfast is included and the hotel has A/C, both unusual for Paris in a two or three star hotel. The location is ideal and speaks for itself plus, the street has a number of useful shops and restaurants. This hotel is really a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, big rooms, great breakfast, friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: BoaWe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 8 nights, in a lovely tripel room. The room had a small sofa where we could sit in the evening looking out through the french doors at the nightlife. Breakfast was a treat. The area is full of small restaurants and there was entertainment in every corner especially in front of Notre Dame. Near to shopping and sightseeing. Just 100 m to RER station (for airport) and metro. We would love to come back to this great hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Small Hotel with all the Basics Right”
Reviews.Author: Luxique
Reviews.Content: I was there middle of July and got their biggest room available. I'd stayed there before and back then my room was really tiny with poor lightings but this one was really good. Great size for my luggage, bathroom was bright and huge too. I love the natural light that shines through every morning as well. A slight pity though was the furnishing were a little old, and I saw specks of hair on the headboard of the bed that sort of put me off. Otherwise, all's good. Breakfast is included in the room rates - but very simple fair - Croissant, loaf and beverages. Another note: the manager of the hotel was not very helpful despite knowing my wallet was stolen in the Metro. All she wanted was for me to foot my hotel bill (I had to cut short my stay and return home as all my Credits cards and cash were stolen) and nothing else. She made me feel like a Cheat. It was only when I managed to get my bank to unblock for a short while for the charge to be accepted that she soften a little. That's not the right way to treat a returned guest who travels solo and is distress with her loss! For this part, I take away one star.

Reviews.Title: “a useful and helpful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seren2012
Reviews.Content: Just off the Blvd St Michel and the heart of the student quarter, this hotel is in a great and convenient location close by to the metro and walk-able everywhere. The staff are very helpful and the breakfast, decent. Single rooms are quiet , clean and small - but at that price, one cannot complain. The only negative point was a funny musty-damp smell in the very clean bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: fionahay
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed four nights in an air-conditioned executive suite at this centrally located hotel. Our girls were safely accommodated in their own room, and we were next door, with both rooms accessed by outer door to the hallway, so it was very private. Yes, Paris hotel rooms are small, but we knew that ahead of time, so if anything, we were pleasantly surprised at the size of our combined spaces. Despite the hotel's location on a bustling street, the rooms, which faced an inner courtyard area, were nice and quiet. We heard no noise from other travelers, either. We enjoyed eating breakfast at the hotel, where we were offered tea, coffee, juice, a selection of bread and pastries, cold cuts, cheese, fruit, two kinds of cereal, and plain yogurt. Staff were unfailingly helpful and friendly. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic - not a great choice”
Reviews.Author: Jack02
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris with two members of my family. Location of the hotel is spot on and the price seemed reasonable but in fact you get what you pay for. We stayed there two nights. The decor of the hotel is very dated (horrible carpet, hanging power sockets, bangining bedroom doors) and our room was of a very poor standard. We stayed in a room for 3 and there was a double bed and a tiny and very uncomfortable single bed located just by the door with no ventilation. The bed is clearly for kinds becasue an adult can hardly fit there. The room itself was dark, dingy, with ugly big pictures on the walls and very smelly -smelt of damp. The bathroom had no window so there was a lot of water in the air after we showered. The toilet was in a seperate room with no window or basin to wash your hands after doing your business. Breakfast is fine but a bit chaotic with a lot of pople eating and just one extremely overworked lady trying to manage the whole breakfast room. There is free wi-fi but it only works in the reception area since there was no signal in the bedroom!!! The last night we stayed in a hotel Henry VI which is just around the corner and just 40 euros more. It was so much better with big, clean and specious room. Big and modern bathroom. It was just lovely and worth every penny. I wished we had stayed there instead of below-the-standard Hotel Du Levant!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyJulia
Reviews.Content: After much research into hotels in Paris we chose Hotel du Levant and were very happy that we did! It is in a great location for walking everywhere, is nice and quiet, clean, good beds, has friendly helpful staff, a delicious breakfast included every morning, and a solid history of taking care of their customers. No - the rooms aren't huge, but who cares, you are in Paris, and you aren't spending much time in your room anyway. We couldn't recommend this hotel more highly - it is an excellent choice - and you will be happy you chose it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: mcgl
Reviews.Content: You couldn't be more cental that you'd be staying in this hotel. Minutes to the Seine and close to Notre Dame, in a lively little street full of cafes. Despite the busy street the room, though small, was very quiet, even though the window opened onto the lift shaft. Staff reasonably friendly. Good breakfast included and served in lovely breakfast room. Comfortable guest lounge also available. Only complaint was a really bad smell coming from the bathroom pipes at times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel + Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityAlex
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 4 nights at the du Levant and liked it very much. I have stayed at many locations throughout the city and always found the hotels isolated (for example, one in the vicinity of the Eiffel Tower). This time I wanted to stay in a bustling area but I hate noise at night (I know, that's a contradiction). But this hotel in the Latin Quarter is perfect. A very lively area, the hotel is in the middle of it, and in my fifth floor apartment facing the street, I heard almost nothing in the middle of the night when I needed to rest. The staff were very nice people and very tolerant of me and the other Americans there, who really don't go much further than 'bon jour'. (We really do love France, which is why we keep coming back, but we just don't have the time to learn such a beautiful language.) Room was perfectly clean and it was nice to return after a long day of taking pictures. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: travelbounder
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Du Levant sits next to the Metro stop and the RER line coming in from the airport. It also is close to the Cluny Museum, up the street from the Sorbonne, and across the river from Notre Dame and Marais neighborhood. The rooms have been thought of as small, but the price is comparable. We did get an Executive room this time, and it was quite spacious, for Paris. However, there was little storage for clothes (it was supposed to house 3 people). Le toilet was in a separate place than the tub and sink, but both in the room. You couldn't leave your windows open at night because of street noise (Latin Quarter), but when closed , it was very quiet. Breakfast is fresh and french---both good things: great yogurt, cereals, hot croissants and bread, self-catered eggs, fruit and jams, The staff is quite helpful and speaks English. But if you want location, this is it--less than 1/2 a block to the Metro, around the corner from a news stand with Int'l Herald Trib, but the restaurants on the street were not recommended by the staff. A short walk remedies that problem.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location!”
Reviews.Author: TexasZuggie
Reviews.Content: The location was the best part of our stay at the Hotel du Levant. And the hotel was OK for an European city hotel in that price range. The room was clean and smelled good, and the bed was comfy. Our room ( a standard double) was incredibly small. The toilet was in a separate little closet, and two people manuvering around the room was very awkward. It was OK for the two nights we were there, but wouldn't have wanted to stay longer. The bathroom resembled a cruise ship bathroom. Breakfast was good and the staff spoke fair English. A couple we were traveling with had a problem with their reservation and were initally told there was no room at the inn for them. It was clearly the hotel's fault that the reservation was lost. After an hour long session of trying to get this all worked out (staff wasn't real eager to try to find them another hotel), they were finally given a room that had just been repainted and they didn't want to rent that night because of the paint fumes. So, bottom line, we loved the location. the hotel was OK for two nights. But next trip we'll seek out another hotel in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location! Close to Notre Dame and Metro Station and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: momma_christa
Reviews.Content: You have to love a hotel that is tucked behind a Crepe Restaurant and only 3 min. of walking to either the st. Michele Metro or Notre Dame Cathedral. The rooms were lovely and clean and beds slept well. You are tucked right into a restaurant district so great food is just steps away. The beds were comfortable. The atmosphere was relaxing and about being taken care of. The breakfast every morning was wonderful. The fresh food was a great way to start the day. The small and quaint lift makes you feel like you are in a bogart movie. The staircase should be used for pictures. The feel of the building makes you think about history and elegance. ...without being stuffy. We will be back. I cannot fathom staying in any other area of Paris after staying here.

Reviews.Title: “good but I probably wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: Angelrah79
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that this place was probably just a matter of personal taste. The room was small, very typical of Paris hotel rooms I'm told. Incredibly, although the bathroom was small, it did have a bath - thank goodness, since I really needed to soak my legs at the end of each day. The room was quiet. Breakfast was good and the service was fast. I was disappointed about the quality of the advice we were given on the front desk - we were sent on a half hour walk to a self service laundry on our first night (or we could arrange to do it the next day through the hotel), but subsequently found two for ourselves less than half that distance away. I didn't particularly like the location in the Latin Quarter which was very busy. I'm sure there were some good places to eat nearby but we never managed to choose one of them. It was very close to a metro and RER station but I would probably choose a quieter neighborhood next time.

Reviews.Title: “A great location close to centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Herondancer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights last weekend. It was recommended to us by a friend who had stayed there previously. The hotel was everything that previous reviewers claimed - great location, central, clean, nice staff, good breakfast, quirky lift, noisy and lively area - but I don't think it was cheap. It cost us €175 per night including a nice breakfast but in the end it was worth it. We didn't use the metro - except to get to/from the airport as the weather was great and the hotel was within walking distance of all the main sights - except Montmartre. Our room (number 50) was a bit strange at first - pink walls, pink chandeliers, and a weird relief on the wall. My wife described as a bit like a high class French brothel out of Moulin Rouge - but that was part of the charm !! The area is noisy but nice and busy - our room was at the back so it was quiet. The only downside was the room was very hot and it wasn't possible to adjust the AC (and we didn't ask either). The Batobus (hop-on hop-off boat service on the Seine) is very close beside Notre Dame and the two day all day ticket at €18 is really good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Clean rooms, Great value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: adajos
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel du Levant for three nights. The rooms are small (it is Paris, so they are small unless you want to go broke) but they were clean and quiet. The hotel is about a 1 minute walk away from Notre Dame and there a plethora of dining options within a 5 minute walk in the Latin Quarter (just steer clear of the overly touristy places). Also there were RER stops and metro stops within a 1-2 minute walk as well. The price was reasonable (again, for Paris) and I would certainly stay here again. The thing that was odd about our room was that the sink, shower, vanity area did not have a toilet near them, it was in what amounted to a small closet in a separate corner of our room. It was all functional though and we certainly would not stay at a hotel where our room did not have a private bathroom. There was a very nice European-style breakfast included which we very much appreciated. The staff were friendly, helpful and spoke English. Stay here if you want a good hotel that won't break the bank and is convenient for sightseeing in the wonderful city of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: mcadoo11
Reviews.Content: The primary reason to stay at Hotel du Levant is its incredible location, within a few steps of the RER express train to Charles de Gaulle airport, and a few blocks from Notre Dame in the heart of the Rive Gauche activity. The price - 170 euros night -- for a twin seemed excessive for the small room with one large double bed and a shoehorned in 2nd bed that was very cramped for my 6-foot-plus teenage son. The toilet was in a separate "compartment" from the shower / sink, which was odd. Got a room backing to an interior courtyard which was nice. Had a television but only 3 channels. Breakfast room was nice, but choices limited and did not change our three days there. No on-site Internet computer was inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but cheaper rooms are cheap for a reason.”
Reviews.Author: dau84
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby, but single, cheaper rooms are very small and mine smells incredibly dank. It's also overheated and the window opens right over a loud bar. The gentleman downstairs did not particularly care when I called down to inform him about this dilemma. Good thing I brought ear plugs, as I'll need them with the window closed anyhow. Yes, it's that loud. I wish I could say the cleanliness and non-lumpy bed made up for the other problems, but no...not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay at Hotel du Levant”
Reviews.Author: westernflyer1955
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent several days in Paris at the Hotel du Levant. This was my third stay at this great little hotel, ideally located in the Latin Quarter about five minutes' walk from Notre Dame. This is an older hotel - built circa 1900 - rooms are quite small but very clean and cozy. Note that the lift is also very small, and you might require more than one trip to bring your luggage to your room. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. We paid 150 euro per night, which included a very nice breakfast - fantastic bread, self-cooked boiled eggs, fresh fruit, yogurt, etc. Hotel du Levant was highly recommended to me by a French colleague.

Reviews.Title: “Just alright if you don't mind hot humid, unventilated room”
Reviews.Author: yogaeon
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice eating places around, especially MAOZ falafel outlet, nice staff--speak english too. The standard single room was more or less a small den with no ventilation, even not in the bathroom/toilet. Alright if you are here for a few days and plan to move around in Paris. Breakfast was okay...not many options though.

Reviews.Title: “consistently wonderful”
Reviews.Author: govol
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel du Levant for the 5 past summers. Anywhere from 3 days to a week. It is always a delight to return there. The rooms are quite pleasant and the baths are updated with very nice tiles, hairdryers, good showers etc etc. As Americans, we are used to more and larger towels. However, this is not a big deal.hsi I have referred Hotel du Levant to at least 5 different friends and they have all been pleased. This to me, is a great commentary as most of these couples are seasoned travelers - and they have had the fortune to travel at a very high level. The complimentary breakfast is superb. I am looking forward to summer 2011 and taking up residence (for too short a time) in the lovely Hotel du Levant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence of location, price, service”
Reviews.Author: szane
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! 5 minutes walk from Notre Dame and 10 m from Le Louvre and the Sorbonne - surrounded by bars & restaurants. The friendliness of the staff could not have been improved upon. Very minor gripe only - since only one staff member is on duty for breakfast, occasionally food and crockery was absent or late coming out and you can't get breakfast before 7a.m. Also only 5 minutes to where the France Tourisme sightseeing buses leave from - a help for those early morning starts! This hotel was recommended to me by several friends and I will be doing likewise. One of the best 3 star hotels around and at E170 a night incl. breakfast, excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: WanderWoman55
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in small but comfortable and clean single room on sixth floor. Very quiet room; no noise from outside or other guests. Hotel desk staff welcoming and helpful with restaurant suggestions (suggested Chez Clement for a late lunch...restaurant nearby with nice terrace dining and good food). Breakfast had fairly good selection, but dining room is cramped and service hurried. Great location a stone's throw from the river, Notre Dame, and short walk to Lux Gardens. Street outside crammed with tourist restaurants, so rather busy, especially at night, but interior of hotel was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Darling hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: TimeTraveller58
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on the Paris tourism website and thought it was a bargain price so I checked Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed. The location is fabulous in the Latin Quarter, 10 minute walk to Notre Dame, 15 minute walk to the Louvre and about 2-3 miles from the Eiffel Tower as well as Metro and train connections at the top of the street. The hotel staff are very helpful and friendly. The rooms are a typical European size with the bathrooms and showers (at least in my room) slightly larger than the norm. My room opened onto an inner courtyard and was very quiet at night. The room was nicely decorated and bed was comfortable. Breakfast is provided with stay. The hotel is on a street of restaurants with a lively atmosphere in the evening. My colleagues were able to use the free WiFi to send emails.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pippaatdunskey
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Levant provides a great location, friendly and helpful staff, comfortable rooms, and a good continental breakfast. My friends and I also found it excellent value for money for Paris and we would happily recommend it to anyone. It is also very convenient for Metro and RER stations and 5 minutes walk from Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3 star budget hotel in heart of Latin Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: 8legged
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at luxury resorts for $1000 a night and on a gym mat for $6. Hotel du Levant is a solid budget hotel with walkable distances to major sites like Cathedrale du Notre Dame and easy access to metro stops. There are no extravagances here but just cozy decor and pleasant staff. The Plusses of my stay: + it's on major metro lines. It took me 2 stops from Gare du Nord to get here. Walked to hotel from Metro St. Michel in less than 5 minutes. + Location cannot be beat. It's in the heart of the Latin Quarter which gets lively. Walk out and survey your eating options: crepe stands, sidewalk cafes and ethnic restaurants are plentiful. + I stayed in Room 49. There's a lift and the room is facing the inner buidling thus no street view which is fine b/c the street can get noisy. + Twin beds are decent but not plush. I managed to konk out each of four nights. + Bathroom is modern and showerhead was fixed asap when we complained. + Breakfast is decent and included in price of stay. Includes coffee, water, juice, cereal, yogurt, boiled eggs, cheese slices, ham slices, baguette and croissant + Reception is always pleasant + Area is safe. If were travelling alone i have no qualms as a solo traveller. + TV reception fine but why watch it when you have Paris outside the room. + Lobby is plush red! I loved hanging out there. So warm and cozy! + Fashion illustrations line the hallways and room walls. I love the decor! + Vibrant decor in nearly every room. I poked into some of them realize room numbers ending in 8, 9 and 0 do not face street and may be quieter than other rooms if you are sensitive to noise. The Minuses of my stay: - Upon check-in we were handed wrong room keys until we finally got our twin bed option. May need to reconfirm your stay because they couldn't find our reservation. Best to print out your confirmation before showing up. - Space is tight. I had to put my suitcase on the desk and my friend used the luggage shelf. - The pricing of a double room is more each person than booking two single rooms at EUR 76 each Final say: I'd rebook. It's location is unbeatable. It gives me a place to rest and recharge before going back out to take on Paris on a full tank.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel, great area”
Reviews.Author: Selina188644
Reviews.Content: I just love the Hotel Levant rue de la Harpe, Near Boul St Michel. It manages to be cosy and the staff are always friendly. It is clean and business like, without being too impersonal. Also it is next door to a fantastic creperie, mmmm and therue de la Harpe is so fantastically lively

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location surrounded by great restaurants and Notre Dame”
Reviews.Author: kswiersma
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room on the 3rd floor. The hotel is between 2 great train stops, one metro and the other RER. This is extremely convenient when you are traveling to Versailles or Disneyland. It truly has free wifi. We had 4 ipod devices and we were able to connect with all of them. The connection was not always perfect but it was OK. I was able to skype most of the time. The rooms are old but clean, the bathrooms are updated, CNN and BBC. Breakfast was fine. Everyone was very helpful. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: stirlia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a confort double room over looking the court yard at the back. The Hotel service was great and the room was very clean. We had no problems with noise or smells. As for the location you could not get easier to get around from. It is minutes from the RER B line from CDG airport or Gare Du Nord. The open top bus stops very near and if you are feeling fit the only place you can not walk to is sacre-coeur. Breakfast was fine for a paris hotel. I would stay here again. For the same price I have stayed in worst UK hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you can deal with the smell and the noise”
Reviews.Author: hudi
Reviews.Content: The first night we had room 26 which faces the street and the noise was deafening. Unfortunately we weren't able to switch rooms until the next day, so no sleep. Also there was a smell that was something like oil paint and bug spray mixed in with sewer smell. The next room, number 39, was in the back so it was very quiet...until the family with the screaming kid moved in next door. But that SMELL!! This time it was very definitely coming from the open drains in the bathroom and it smelled like that old sewer smell you get sometimes in the city. It was so strong it was nauseating. But it was a holiday weekend and trying to find another place was too difficult so we stuck it out. The good thing about this place is the location. It is one block from the Seine and a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame. The rooms were clean but the carpet and furnishings are very old. And with the exception of one night manager the staff was all surly and ready to bite your head off. Not a pleasant experience. I should have known when this place was available when all others were not.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Evelien69
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we went to Hotel du Levant. We love it here. Other times in Paris we had to use the metro a lot but if you stay here you can walk to most of the attractions. It is minutes away from the great shopping area St Germain, just across the bridge from the Notre Dame and minutes from the Louvre and Rue de Rivoli. The hotel itself is good value, we had a family room which worked out fine for us. The breakfast is complimentary and has croissants, french bread, eggs, ham, cheese, juice and tea, coffee or hot chocolate. There is wireless internet in the room. In the street there are many restaurants but also really good restaurants within walking distance. There are 2 Starbucks just around the corner, and the metro and RER are around the corner aswell. We parked our car in the parking garage under the Notre Dame. There is enough space and the rate wasn't so high (compared to the rates in Amsterdam!). Our next time in Paris we will defenitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MicheleSF
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is ideally located to use RER to and from CDG airport, and walking to all the sites of Paris. As a female solo traveler, I felt perfectly safe. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Morning breakfast was a treat. In addition, the hotel is literally surrounded by a multitude of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE IN PARIS”
Reviews.Author: SoBeNomad
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel about four times, in the middle of summer and the middle of winter. The single rooms are cozy (European small) and they, and the bathrooms, are modern and very nice. In fact, each time but once, I had the same room - which made me very happy. I've stayed in 2 star to 4L star hotels in Paris and this one is the best value. Each time that I visited Paris (now about 25-30 times) I searched for new, good value hotels. My search is over. I now stay at this hotel only and if it is sold out, I change my dates. Single rooms must be booked well in advance. The breakfast is simple, but it is free. The rooms have good wireless Internet and it is FREE too! I've arrived early in the day, late at night, left very early, and I have never had any problem with my check-in or check-out, billing issues, room servicing, staff issues, etc. The front desk staff always greeted me with a smile and were ALWAYS very helpful to both me and other guests. One of the best things about this hotel is that it is located on the RER which is the direct rail line to Charles de Gaulle Airport. In the area are many restaurants, inexpensive concerts in beautiful churches, tourist shops, and bookstores. It is a 5 minute walk to the Seine River, about 7 minutes walk to Notre Dame. On nice days, it is a pleasant and safe stroll to the Grand Boulevards area. The Louvre is also a nice 20 minute or so walk. It is truly in the heart of Paris. I was in the travel industry for nearly 30 years, and this hotel has been my first choice for Paris since I first stayed there about 2 years ago.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best value hotels in the Latin Quarter for a single traveller”
Reviews.Author: FoxyRhino
Reviews.Content: Having won some free flights to Paris, I discovered the Hotel Du Levant on a Paris website. The hotel is perfectly situated for the sightseer being situated in the Latin Quarter near to Notre Dame cathedral and a 30 minute train ride on the RER from Charles De Gaulle airport takes you within a 5 minute walk of the hotel. I had a single room which was clean and had a comfortable bed and an en-suite bathroom with shower cubicle. The TV has both BBC World News and CNN as well as several French channels. The area around the hotel comprises of several narrow roads with many, many restaurants and bars nearby. At night, the area is very busy but as my hotel room had a view of a wall of an adjacent builidng, the noise wasn't noticeable even at night. Breakfast was typical continental breakfast (cornflakes, fruit, baguette and croissant with ham, cheese and jam available) as well as boiled eggs. Given that most of the hotels nearby have a minimum rate of almost double what I paid for the single room, it must be the best value hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Mebaka
Reviews.Content: 1. The location was great, great great. Right on the rue de la Harpe; a 2-minute walk to the St. Michel metro station and 2 minutes away from the Cluny-Sorbonne metro station. Restaurants right outside. You are right in the center of a very touristy but fun and lively area. A McDonalds a 2-minute walk (and internet place next to the McDonalds. This is for people who want to stay in the middle of a noisy, youthful, lively and fun tourist area. The Seine was a block or so way, so I could just pop outside anytime to get my view of Notre Dame at anytime. St. Germain area 5-minutes away. Having two metro stations so close also made it easy to get to places farther away. The Louvre was also only a 15-minute walk across the Seine. Although tour books list lots of hotels, I have to stress, being right in the center of the action was great. In the evening, I would think, hey, I want to see Notre Dame again, and I could walk literally just a few minutes and have Notre Dame all lit up, right in front of me. 2. The price was excellent. A breakfast buffet with croissant, bread, cheese, ham, cereal, hard-boiled eggs, yoghurt, juice and coffee was included. Booked directly on their website. 3. The hotel was a typical 6-story (or so) building. The lobby was small but nicely-furnished. There was a small breakfast room. There was a small elevator. 4. The ensuite room was a bit small (but average for France), clean and nicely furnished. The window opened to the interior space of the building and was quiet. The bed was comfortable. TV had CNN and BBC. There was also a fridge, which was great for keeping cold drinks. There was individually-controlled A/C, which was great to have, as it was quite hot when I was there in early July. The bathroom was or average size, had a shower, W/C, and shampoo, soap and lotion. For this price, for a hotel in this location, with A/C and a fridge, THIS is a steal!!! 5. The front staffers were efficient, friendly and spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: TraveltoseetheWorld
Reviews.Content: Fantastic value in the BEST location in Paris. When I was trying to find a hotel in Paris I really had no clue where to stay. After reading reviews about this hotel I figured I'd give it a try. WOW, this was a great end to my trip. First the location can't be beat. Within walking distance to many major sights and a just a block to the metro/RER stations. The nightlife is right outside the door with tons of shops and restaurants. It's just a short walk to the river where you can sit and watch street performers at night. The hotel staff was amazing. Me and my friend booked single rooms. The front desk lady was really nice and made sure we had rooms on the same floor. In fact we had windows that opened into a quiet alley where we could talk back and forth. It seems the rooms are customized to the shape of the building. My friends room was nice and square while my room was a little tighter squeeze. However, this was not big deal. The bathroom was spacious and clean. I felt really safe here and would recommend this place to the single traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: miwi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our family, we had 2 rooms, a twin and a triple. The twin room was very pink! but nice. The triple was airy and comfy - the decor slightly tired but as we were rarely in it, it didnt matter. This hotel is in a very busy street with lots of restaurants and bars. It has several metro stations that are very close by that makes getting around the city really easy. The metro once you get the hang of it is fantastic. Sites like Notre Dame, St Chappelle and Concierge are a short stroll away. The breakfast at the hotel was fine, juice, croissants, cheese,ham,cereal,fruit and hot drinks. The breakfast room is small and I would recommend getting down early to avoid a wait for a table. The restaurants around the hotel are plenty and of varied quality and although this is classed as the student area, don't expect student prices. We found eating and drinking out pricey so take plenty of money! The Italian restuarant on the same side of the street to the left of the hotel was good, the french restuarant just before it not so good. This is a good, basic, clean hotel and the staff were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: SteveT
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and wonderful location with restaurants outside the door and Notre Dame five minutes away. Typical size Paris rooms but with sufficient space.

Reviews.Title: “Bhotel Du Levant –Paris , Best Location”
Reviews.Author: paulboop
Reviews.Content: HOTEL DU LEVANT –PARIS BEST LOCATION The location ,location, location .Two minutes walk from the Place St Michel Metro station from where the RER Express subway takes us directly to Charles de Gaulle airport .Five minutes walk to Notre Dame cathedral and the same to St . Germain des Près or to the rue de Buci area, studded with interesting restaurants . The rooms and bathroom are small but spotlessly clean and adequately modern. There’s plenty of hot water .The rates are reasonable for the area and include a pleasant ,continental breakfast .We’re going back in May. Paul +Boop : Canada –Thailand

Reviews.Title: “Not the best value for money you can find....”
Reviews.Author: dmoisidis
Reviews.Content: I would have rated it with more stars if it wasn't for the first day of my arrival. I arrived there with my wife on the 16th of June and even though I've booked the hotel 3 months earlier, they gave us a bed with a bad bed. Bad bed as in squeaky bed. You couldn't even sit on it and it made all these horrible noises and of course we went to the manager to complaint and to ask him either to change the bed or to move us to a different room. Only after long pressure and threats that we would look to find a different hotel, did he moved us to a different room on the next day. But alas, the first day of our trip to Paris was stigmatized by that stupid incident. And you don't want that from the hotel right? Well the rooms were really small and the toilet made me wondering....Why on earth would on put the WC on a different room that the bathroom? It was really funny but the WC was like a confiding room, not for claustrophobics. The location was nice but rather noisy and the staff quite friendly but they give BAD info, so be careful. If I ever visit Paris again, I would look for a better and cheaper hotel, because it was very expensive for what it offered.....

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Surprising-Virginia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our 16 year old grand-daughter, had the triple (a double bed plus a single bed) at Hotel Du LeVant for four nights in late July and early August 2008. We were very pleased with the accommodations and especially the location. Our total rate of 175 Euros per night included a pleasant buffet breakfast (7 am until 10 am) each morning where one can also boil their own eggs to satisfaction. Our room was air conditioned and the toilet was in a separate private space in our room, away from the bathroom sink and shower. This proved very convenient when three of us are all dressing for the early morning sightseeing starts. The St-Michel RER train and Metro station is at one end of rue de la Harpe (next to McDonalds restaurant), so we took the RER train from Charles De Gaulle airport with our baggage, took the St-Michel exit, strolled half a block, and there's the hotel. There is also an internet cafe named "Milk" on the street where we bought 30 minutes of internet use for three euros. Also nearby, there are some markets - similar to 7-11's but with a lot more produce - named 8 a' Huit (8 to 8) where you can stock up on water, beer, wine and other snack or pic-nic foods by the 6 or 12 pack if you want to save some money. The hotel is also a short walk to Notre- Dame Cathedral where the open top tour bus originates. I do have to say that the elevator (lift) is very tiny and is crowded with two people and a suitcase - it's not a big problem, as all the plusses far out weigh that negative. But still, the elevator could be a subject to laugh about later on.

Reviews.Title: “terrible smell”
Reviews.Author: paulaplaga
Reviews.Content: The location is great but the hotel was more like a "motel". The cigarette smell was so strong that I talked to the manager to move me to another room. He said there was nothing he could do even if they had plenty of rooms available ( and don’t wonder why...). It was dirty, outdated and dark. I even slept when my clothes on to check out first thing in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: saskeeya
Reviews.Content: Really, the location is excellent, in a small corner of the Latin Quarter with many restaurants although of the somewhat cheaper variety, they didn't all smell very nice. I had a room on the top floor, at the back and I have to say, it was completely quiet so that's a plus. But so small! For 120 Euros I was expection a little bit more, at least some room for a desk to put my laptop on (wifi is free of charge though). Furniture is old, everything is old and a little dusty, bed was pretty bad and the breakfast smells (yes all the way on the 6th floor) were not so nice either. Breakfast is rather bad and a very noisy affair (coming from the kitchen). Service is okay but only if you ask for it. And the elevator is just too scary!

Reviews.Title: “Twin rooms”
Reviews.Author: TiggyLancashire
Reviews.Content: We had a twin room which although decorated very well had an awful toilet in a cupboard in the bedroom which was not pleasant. The bathroom was a very tiny affair with scratchy towels. Our breakfast was very basic with a great deal of keeness to load the dishwasher rather than replenish the basics of milk, ham and cheese. This hotel is very nicely decorated but staff are not very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Jo_Kiwi
Reviews.Content: Couldn't beat the location of this hotel. Heart of the Latin Quarter, half a block back from the Seine and only a few mins walk to Notre Dame. A few Metro/RER stops only a few steps away and many bars, restaurants and cafes all in immediate area. I thought value for money was good, particularly for triple room. It wasn't cheap, but you get what you pay for and this location was worth paying for! We had two rooms and both faced the street and we didn't have and problems with noise, which was surprising given how busy the area was at night (I think the windows might be double glazed). If we had windows open it was noisier. Fantastic breakfast, friendly staff and nice rooms. Clean and comfortable. Triple room was huge with large queen bed and 2 singles (designed for families), with large bathroom (shower over bath and no curtain, so things got a bit wet). I'm a travel agent and have already had clients stay here on my recommendation and they also loved it. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in busy neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: corsw
Reviews.Content: Quaint little hotel in the middle of the Latin Quarter. My wife and I stayed for 7 days over New Years and had a wonderful first trip to Paris. Our room was situated facing the interior of the hotel courtyard (room 21) and was nicely appointed and decorated. I gather that a room facing the street would have been louder at night but ours was very quite. The location as mentioned is excellent with a two minute walk to the metro. Breakfast is simple. Baguette, croissant, eggs that you can boil and coffee and juice. Just enough to start the day off right. The restaurants in the area of the hotel are very touristy but offer a decent selection of food choices. We especially liked the cheese fondue since it's hard to mess that up and it's fun on a cold witners night. Our shower had no door, french but still a little unusual. Water went all over the bathroom floor and the down a drain hole. Not recommended for two or long cleaning sessions. All in all we would stay there again......

Reviews.Title: “hotel is ok hard to find a decent meal near by”
Reviews.Author: lovethesnow7
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean. Staff ok. Not very friendly. I arrived slightly early. Had to wait in the waiting area exhusted for my room to be cleaned. Location is good. Near Metro and buses. It was hard to find a decent place to eat near by. Resturants mediocre and expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent -and I tried Many hotels there -close to Notre Dame”
Reviews.Author: BlueGirlTravel
Reviews.Content: After spending 2 nights in an ETAP, and another night in a horrible, SMELLY, expensive, up-scale hotel named Andrea de Rivoli, I was at witts end....I "hated" Paris b/c I have found it very dirty and smelly! And finally when I had all but given up after visiting hotel after hotel with mold and gruesome smells..I have walked into Hotel du Levant! Literally found it by chance, walking down that street, tired and pissed off;) NO BAD SMELLS! It was nice and clean. The room was painted fuscia or pink :) felt like a dorm room but a very pretty, fun, lively one. I had a mini bar, a very nice TV...the room in itself was pretty big. The bathroom was ok, clean. My only problem there was a blackout in the entire neighbourhood, which lasted a couple of hours:))) Boy was that FUN!!!! Quartier Latin was boiling:) There was a crowd in the streets, people were running and laughing...and hey, some didn't have to pay for their resturant meals cuz there was no cash register working;)))) MOST IMPORTANT -the location is FABULOS. In the mornings I'd walk down to a bistro and sit there, with a view of Notre Dame and the Seine. 5 minute walk to Notre Dame! It's a dream hotel!

Reviews.Title: “cheat”
Reviews.Author: wbenson2
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter and I stayed 2 nights. The first night they overcharged, because we didn't want breakfast. They said they would fix it the next day. That night I got sick from some food and the toilet stopped up. They changed our room assuring us it would be the same price. They overcharged me for breakfast and the room. We left very early to catch a flight and I didn't notice until I got my master charge bill.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: LandyLover
Reviews.Content: The hotel faces a busy street that at night is full of restaurants and bars. But don't worry about the noise, because they have fantastic double glazing and with the windows shut you can't hear a thing... The hotel is clean and friendly, with small but pretty rooms with all mod cons. Breakfast was a typically French affair, focussed on the coffee and croissants. I wouldn't say this place was cheap but it's hard to beat the location. Stumble out of the door and there must be a dozen restaurants within 20 metres of your hotel...

Reviews.Title: “The real buzz of Paris”
Reviews.Author: ChantalElgie
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from yet another stay at the Hotel Du Levant. We were there last June and loved the hotel, and particularly our room so when we went back this year we booked the same room, number 36, overlooking the street, which they were able to accommodate us. As far as Paris hotel rooms go (& I have stayed in a few) the room & ensuite bathroom are both a decent size, with crisp, fresh linen on the beds, upmarket toiletires in the bathroom, somewhat 'bohemian' decor, but very clean & tidy. The room is also airconditioned. The room we stayed in had a flat screen TV, but being English speaking we only got the benefit of watching the international news channels. The room also has a mini-bar which is well stocked (but pricey). The hotel is very close to 2 metro stations & as you walk out of the hotel front door into the narrow street, the Rue de La Harpe, you find yourself in the heart of what Paris is all about. Cafes & restaurants abound with pavement diners & a buzz that has to be experienced to be fully appreciated. Buskers & street artists entertain diners and those just strolling the street. For those who need to mix business with pleasure, there is an internet cafe in the same road as the hotel, about 30m away from the front door (when you turn right out of the hotel). Its quiet in the mornings and gets progressively busier during the day, so go early if you have to use this! There is also a Macdonalds on the corner near the internet cafe, a saving grace when you have an 11 year old who is not into the more 'sophisticated' foods that are available in this area's restaurants! Breakfast is included in the room rate and this includes croissants, baguettes, ham, cheese, jams, fruit, yoghurt, cereal, juices & hot beverages. There are also eggs and you can boil these for yourself if you feel so inclined in the egg boiler.The breakfast chairs are not the most comfortable I have experienced but I think this is in an effort to encourage guests not to linger as the breakfast room is small in relation to the number of hotel rooms. My only complaint about the hotel this time around (as there were none the last time) was that on one of the days, we got back at 3pm from a few hours of pounding the streets of Paris, to find that our room had not yet been made up, which was disappointing when we wanted to relax in the room for a bit. All in all I have no reservations in recommending this hotel & will probably retun to it the next time I visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lisaguk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just had our first weekend away together and I am so pleased to say this hotel made that weekend absolutely perfect. The rooms were spacious and clean with marble bathrooms and a reasonably priced minibar. The lobby was cosy but modern (not a creepy floral wallpaper in sight!). The breakfast was basic with cereal, juice, fruit etc, but the Croissants were probably the best I have ever had. The hotel is right in the centre of the action on a road lined with late night cafes and restaurants. There is a restaurant 10 minutes away called Le Maison, if you stay at this hotel go there!!! All in all a perfect stay. We had an amazing weekend and, although Paris is a beautiful place and there is so much to do you really just want a bed for a night (it's not like you'll be spending a great deal of time in the room), it really is nice to come back to a nice hotel where the staff are welcoming and the beds are comfortable. The best 3 star hotel I have ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adigression
Reviews.Content: A friend and I took our children to Paris, April 5-14. We had two rooms, one on the third floor, one on the fifth. We were both satisfied with the accomodations. The rooms were clean although not overly spacious as others have mentioned. The location is hard to beat if you're looking for safe, clean, affordable accomodations in the Latin Quarter. Very convenient to two metro stops and several bus routes. We took the RER from the airport to the Place St. Michel. The hotel is within a very short walking distance. The breakfast was adequate--something for everyone, and enough to give one a good start for the day before setting out. The breakfast staff wasn't overly friendly--terse, but efficient. We never had trouble with seating. Everyone else at the hotel was very nice and helpful with such things as directions to a nearby grocery and booking an early morning taxi. We found the hotel to be very quiet at night. Both our rooms looked out over a courtyard. There is a bustling night life in the evening as there are a variety of restaurants up and down the street and those nearby. Notre Dame, the Conciergerie, Sainte Chapelle, Shakespeare and Co., and the Museum of the Middle Ages are very near. We also walked to Louvre and surrounding areas from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time travelling solo!”
Reviews.Author: Samson13
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute trip to Paris, just to wander around the city for 3 days solo. I had read the other reviews for this hotel on Tripadvisor, and also saw the name mentioned on other sites. I contacted the property directly and reserved my room, with no problems via email. Their front desk was good enough to even send me directions on how to reach their hotel from the airport, via the metro. When I arrived the staff was friendly, check-in was easy, and the room was ready and clean. The hotel and room were fairly small, but I was expecting that ( apparently all Parisian hotels are small), and it still provided plenty of space for me and my things. I also had my own private washroom/shower. I was offerred a great rate as a solo traveler, and it included tax and breakfast. The breakfast room is very cute, and the breakfast was enjoyable; being that the dining is so expensive in Paris, it was nice to have a good meal that was included in my rate. During my stay the hotel staff were great at giving me advice on how to get around, what to see, and where to eat. The best part of this hotel is the location; it is truly at the heart of Paris. On foot I visited everything; it is steps away from Notre Damn, Pont Neuf, and other major attractions. I was even able to walk all the way to the Louvre the very first night I was there. In the morning I was able to hear church bells in the distance, as there was a window I could open for fresh air. The street the hotel is on is busy, but I enjoyed coming back to the hotel at night because the street was not deserted; there are also several food stands and an internet cafe on the same street ( McDonalds too!). But it is not too busy, and the crowd seems to disperse by midnight; some of the other streets were either deserted or had hoards of people, to the point where you could not walk down it, this street is a happy medium. I had heard from another guest that there room was a bit noisy because their room faced the street, but that was not an issue for me. Also as a solo female traveler I felt very safe within the hotel, and traveling the streets surrounding the hotel. Overall I would absolutely recommend this hotel, it was clean, and welcoming, and the location could not have been more ideal. For my first trip to Paris I feel lucky to have had such a great experience, and staying with this hotel was part of that.

Reviews.Title: “Near perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MacinLaguna
Reviews.Content: I used this site to find this Hotel, and read each of the reviews before booking. Now that I'm home I wanted to share my own experience. This Hotel is in the best possible location in Paris. It is very easy to use the B train from CDG airport, and the metro stop (St Michel) is also right at the corner. You can walk to most major attractions or hop on the Metro and be anywhere in Paris in minutes. If you arrive on a Sun/Mon buy the Carte Orange the weeks pass saves you a lot. The Hotel could not be any nicer, the staff was very helpful, I had my laundry done during my stay, and they called many restraunts for me. The breakfast was excellant, I made my poached egg and had a basket of breads with cheese and ham each morning in a very nice breakfast room. My room was very small but perfect for me, the linens were new and fresh, the int. design was well thought out, I did not hate the pink, see my attached pictures. The bath was modern and clean with plenty of hot water. The neighborhood is fun and the shopping is geared for the Pariseans. I have been to Paris many times and always felt a little lost and overwhelmed. That was all resolved by staying at a great hotel where I could feel safe and centered. When I came in the night before my departure,(New Years '07) there was a box of chocolats on my desk, at $83.00 a night this is the best find in Europe. I can not recommend this hotel highly enough, I will only stay here when I return to Paris. Bon Voyage.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel du Levant
HotelInfo.Address: 18 rue de la Harpe, 75005 Paris, France
